Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel in March after reading reviews on another network - but I was extremely disappointed. We booked mainly for the inclusive breakfast and the high standard of cleanliness. However on both points we were very disappointed. The room - despite having paid extra for a 'superior' was very small and very dark, needing the light on even first thing in the morning; and although we had a great view of the Empire State Building there were no chairs or tables to sit at if we brought our breakfast back - which we had to do as the breakfast room was always full and extremely hot! On the subject of breakfast - forget the hotel and walk across town rather than uptown, where there are some superb and very cheap cafes - forget the one next door to the hotel - it was FILTHY. We stayed for 4 nights in this hotel and on check out could write our names in the dust on thr bedside table. Also, toothpaste spilt on the sink on the first night of our stay was still there when we checked out. (We deliberately didn't clean it up just to check how long it remained there.) On the first day we reported that the bath plug didn't work, it took 2 days before it was fixed. Another gripe - considering we arrived in the middle of a heatwave - each evening when we returned from dinner, someone had been into the room and turned the air conditioning off. Not a major point - but very annoying. (Especially as that person had used the loo whilst in the room.) Good points were definitely the door staff - Anthony and Angel were great. I've been to NYC before, but they gave loads of advice where to go and how to get there. Recommend using the subway with a Metro card (if you go the wrong way - it costs nothing to go the right way.) Also, try Houston's Restaurant (27th and 5th Ave) 3 blocks walk from the hotel - AMAZING!

Reviews.Title: “a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: LorriJ
Reviews.Content: just had a wonderful week in new york with three friends and would go back to the broadway plaza hotel in a heartbeat. originally I read all the reviews on trip advisor and then confirmed with a travel agent that the hotel looked nice and seemed like a good choice from an economical point of view. it is situated in the wholesale part of town but even walking home in the evening we felt very safe. we walked home from times square several nights and it was fine.there is also some good bargains to be found in the area. the staff are so friendly and our room was a huge junior suit giving the four of us space. we had two queen beds and a pull out couch. with the couch was a sitting area and a fridge. then by the other end of the room was a small sitting area with a table and two chairs by the window- bonus was the view of the empire state building. the room was great and Richard the concierge was so helpful not only in recommending tours and restaurants but also in hailing down taxis and giving us directions for anywhere we wanted to go. great place which I look forward to retuning to. Sherwood Park Alberta Canada

Reviews.Title: “great place and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Vauxhall27
Reviews.Content: I have jus arrived home from New York and a four night sat at the Braodway Plaza hotel. The hotel is in a great location, one block from Fifth Avenue and a ten minute walk to all the shops, Times Square and the Empire State Building. When we arrived the hotel staff were very friendly and could not have been more helpful and welcoming throughout our stay. The rooms were very clean and spacious, 4 of us shared a two bed superior room and it never felt cramped. The bathroom was a decent size too with fresh towels and maid service daily. The hotel provide continental breakfast which was nice but fairly basic! the bagels and doughnuts were very nice, there was also fresh fruit and tea and coffee. My three friends and I really loved new york and our stay at the Broadway Plaza, i would definitely stay there again on my next visit to New York and would recommend it to anyone for location, cleanliness of room and the pleasant and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NY07
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a 1 week and all we could say is to recommend this place. All the staff of the Broadway Plaza Hotel are very kind and helpful and the hotel offers a good quality of services. You can ask them anything you want they will help you as best as they can. The rooms were lovely, calm and comfortable with a fantastic view on the Empire State Building. Rooms are equipped with air conditionning, huge TV ,very comfortable beds and bathroom comes with a tube & hair dryer, as well as an iron table. The hotel is in a great location within walking distance from the main attractions (Times Square, Empire State Building, Madison Sq., Greenwich village...). The subway is located near the hotel or you can easily catch a taxi. This hotel is a very good value for money. We had a fantastic time and would recommend this hotel to anyone who wish to visit NY.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain rate hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BillEmison
Reviews.Content: Broadway Plaza Hotel is a very nice and clean hotel targeted to value-conscious travelers - I highly recommend it! The rooms are spacious and comfortable but the neighborhhod is a bit dodgy. Don't worry about the location - it is very convenient and you will not be bothered by the local street vendors. For the $$$, this hotel cannot be beat. I will definitely return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “100% Recommended”
Reviews.Author: alex_210
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel located at the heart of NYC. Staff were very friendly! Rooms very cleans! Facilities were the same! Recommended for every kind of people/traveler!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in NY”
Reviews.Author: proy
Reviews.Content: Just returned yesterday from a 4 day stay at the Broadway Plaza. We stayed in the large 2 bedroom suite. The room and bathroom was very spacious and very clean. There was more then enough room for the 4 adults and 1 child staying in the room. The continental breakfast was very good, the hotel lobby and personnel were exceptional. The hotel is located in the warehouse district were during the day there are a lot of seedy people hanging around. By 6 pm they are all gone. We felt a little uncomfortable a few time with the locals that hung around the area during the day, but not enough to discourage us to not stay there again. The location is central between lower Manhattan and Central Park which is where we spent most of our time. There is a good restaurant 1 1/2 blocks away called Dona which was really good as well as a really nice deli located a block away that has great take out meals. Walking to Time Square is about 1/2 hour. Our average price was $289 per night for Friday through Monday and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for the price.”
Reviews.Author: reallyreen
Reviews.Content: While booking my hotel I used these reviews as my guide line,so i thought I should contribute. I found the reviews I read to be pretty accurate. The location of the hotel is great for getting around town. It is really close to the yellow line subway (28th & Broadway), and mid town, but not the best neighborhood. The outside of the hotel is basically a narrow doorway. There were always a lot of seedy guys hanging around the outside of the hotel in the day time. What was interesting is they were usually gone in the evening. As far as the inside of the hotel, it was very clean and our room was a good size. We didn't have a great view (it was a small window with a film on it, you couldn't see through), but we had changed rooms because the first room we were given was a smaller bed and room with a great view. I called the front desk saying my reservations were for a king. They were very nice and quick to accomadate us. Staff was great. The free breakfast was just okay. It was in a very small room on the fourth floor only offering breads, Bagels or danish. I wish they had some fruit or lowerfat options. They did have someone in there keeping everything clean and stalked and it was free. Over all I was very happy with our stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: SP7
Reviews.Content: The only thing wrong with the hotel was the slightly seedy location - not nice to look at, but great from the point of view of getting around town. Especially handy for 5th Avenue and the Chrysler Building. The room was large and very clean. Bathroom was fine - lots of hot water, strong shower. Staff were very friendly, helpful and cheerful - even the receptionist, working on Thanksgiving! Great value - would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, great staff, Good sized rooms, poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: scubaminx
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to New York for my 40th birthday. we were greetde by the Consierge who was friendly and proved to be very very helpful during our stay. the entrance is very narrow and the hotel stretches back behind the single door entrance. Our room was comfortable and quite large. The bathroom was clean and quite spacious. The bed was really high and we almost needed a ladder to get into bed every night. But the bedding was clean and bed reasonably comfortable. When I arrived in new York I was extremely unwell and neede to urgently see a doctor. Richard the Consierge sorted everything out and was very helpful. We did try room service, which was OK (but the food in New York I didn't find to be great anywhere!), although this is not run from the hotel . but from a nearby restaurant and you can order beer! The breakfast room has4 tables and is very poor. There is limited choice of pastries and bagels which are all really bland. Location wise the hotel is really central from most of the sites. We tend to walk loads so it made sense for us. Times Square 12 blocks away, Empire State a ten minute walk, we found it excellent. As regards the previous unsavoury area comment, I think it depends what you're used to. Having travelled to both Delhi and Mumbai in the last few months, this area seemed OK: there is no rubbish on the streets, beggars constantly harrassing you or people staring at you and following you! This area is probably little different to most busy areas in a western city. We had an excellent time and would go back to this Hotel for it's Central position and excellent customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: MakisNY
Reviews.Content: My friend and I have just returned from a weekend at New York City. The hotel is very good and we had absolutely no problems with the staff. The room we stayed ( a double twin bed ) was pretty big and clean with a/c, TV, big bathroom and all the comforts. Breakfast was good and very typical New York-ish. The only not pleasant thing I can think of, is the location. Though it is located on Broadway & 27th, this area is not the best to stay in. In fact, it is one of the worst as we have been told by our tour guides. At night, they said, a lot of people go in this area with "bad" habits. Lucky for us the night we stayed there was pouring rain and there was nobody on the streets, having "bad" intentions.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Hotel - Horrible Location”
Reviews.Author: YoungRestlessOne
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Broadway Plaza Hotel from May 23 through May 28, 2007. We booked it as part of a joint airline/hotel package through Travelocity and did save several hundred dollars by doing so. Never again will we skimp. Next time we will pay the extra money to stay in the Time Square area. Technically, there's nothing egregiously wrong with the hotel, but it misleadingly advertises itself as a "boutique" hotel. This couldn't be further from the truth because there's nothing boutique about it. An "economy" hotel would be a better description. The building itself was okay; however, when we arrived the main elevator bank was being worked on (never a good sign), and we had to wait several minutes before we could even go to our room. (There are two elevator banks - one that goes only to the 7th floor and another that goes all the way to the 13th floor). The rooms are clean and appointed well enough, but there are no frills. No extra seating, and the lighting is not the best. No wi-fi or coffee maker. The bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was very spacious by New York hotel standards. This is our 4th trip to New York together, and I used to live there, so I'm familiar with enough hotels to have a basis for comparison. The best asset of this hotel is its staff. They were hospitable, greeting us every time we entered the hotel and holding the door for us when we left. They left us extra towels when we asked for them and also provided satisfactory lunch and dinner recommendations. They would not, however, accommodate an late checkout request. The continental breakfast was serviceable but not the best. Orange juice, coffee, bagles, doughnuts, a few muffins, and a few turnovers. Hardly what I would call a bountiful selection, and the pastries were dry and not that good. The second morning we took advantage of the breakfast we got there around 8:40, 20 minutes before it ended. (The breakfast is only provided from 7:00 to 9:00). All the pastries were gone. The woman in charge of the breakfast area didn't take the initiative to restock even though there were several people waiting in line. (The room, by the way, is tiny and cramped and does not have adequate seating). When I asked her if there were any more turnovers, she didn't even speak to me but instead set about restocking. Her attitude was unpleasant, though, as if she were doing me a favor begrudgingly. I wasn't impressed. Another reviewer mentioned that this hotel probably used to be an office building, and I can definitely see this. Every floor is laid out differently, kind of chopped up in its floor design, and I wondered why there only seemed to be 6 or 7 rooms on each floor. The hallways had a funny smell (the rooms were okay, though), and the lighting was dim in the hallways as well. The decor wasn't warm or inviting. All of these items aside, the main problem is this hotel's location. This hotel is in an unsavory area, and I'm saying this as someone who's lived in different areas of New York. It is right on Broadway, but it's in a sort of "no-man's land" of midtown. By day, it is a little creepy because there are nothing but vendors and roving packs of young kids and thugs. It's an impoverished area, and there's nothing in the immediate area that would attract other tourists, so you are surrounded by masses of locals. If you walk one block north to 28th street, you can catch the NR subway line. If you walk two blocks west over to 7th Avenue and 28th Street, you can catch the red 1 subway line, which is okay by day, but very scary at night. At night, all of the streets around the hotel are desolate, especially the cross blocks. All the shop fronts are gated, and there is hardly anyone around and very few other businesses. It is creepy. On the final night of our stay, we were out late in the Village and took a cab back to the hotel around 1:15 in the morning. Approximately 6 blocks south of the hotel and one cross block over (on 6th Avenue), we encountered swarms of gang members blocking the intersection and preventing traffic from moving. There was an NYPD car in front of our cab that did nothing in spite of the fact that there was gang fighting and violence occurring on the right side of the street. It was a very tense, petrifying few moments as the gang members rushed across the street dodging in and out of traffic. I hurriedly rolled my window up, but was so thankful to finally get back to our hotel. However, I did not sleep well that night because I was so shook up and disconcerted by the fact that this all happened in such close proximity to where we were staying. In short, if you want to be in the heart of the theatre district and withing close walking distance to most of the midtown attractions, this is not the place to be. The hotel is spartan and is in an extremely dicey, unsafe area of town. I did not feel entirely comfortable there, and my partner and I will not stay there again. The few hundred dollars you save aren't worth it. Next time we will spend the extra money and stay further uptown.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the bad reviews, this is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: hipjimmie
Reviews.Content: Staying here for our honeymoon I called a couple days ahead and requested a room with a view. Got a room on the 10th floor with a fantastic view of the Empire State Building! The rooms are very large, and are nicely furnished with comfortable beds, new furniture and repainted walls. There are nice pastries in the morning along with coffee and juice, my only wish is that there would be some fruit also available. The staff was great from the begining to the very end, going beyond all expectations. The hotel may not be in the prime location of Manhatten but is safe, very quiet at night and is one block from the subway station. Overall this is great choice for all, save your money by staying here and spluge it on a nice dinner.

Reviews.Title: “General Manager is an [--]”
Reviews.Author: Ang635
Reviews.Content: Made a reservation to stay in the hotel online. Afew months later I was unable to take the trip. I called the hotel's frontdesk and cancelled my reservation. Recently, I received my credit card bill and found the charge for the room!! The hotel General Manager was a total [--] to me over the phone. He told me I had to have cancelled the reservation online and not on the phone...so now I am screwed out of the $$$$ BEWARE of this hotel's practice if you are considering making a reservation and heaven forbid have to cancel.

Reviews.Title: “Really LOUD elevator”
Reviews.Author: Ryan1971
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine, until I realized that the elevator was so loud, not only did I hear it in my room, but it was difficult to sleep. When I complained about it to the front desk, they told me nothing could be done as the hotel was full. I found it preposterous that they could charge me as much as they did $260 and have that kind of experience. I agree that this was likely an office building turned into a hotel. If my room hadn't been so noisy, it would have been just fine otherwise - comfortable bed, clean and spacious (at least for NY). I will not go back here, for fear of being kept up all night again.

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs down for the Broadway Plaza Hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Mamatoots
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Broadway Plaza hotel on March 20 and March 21. We were very disappointed with the layout of the hotel itself. The hotel looked like it was transformed from an office building to a hotel. You could tell this was the case as there were only less than 5 rooms per floor. Once you were inside the hotel lobby, there wasn't a lobby. No where to sit, no restrooms, only a couple of people behind a desk serving the hotel guests checking in or out. The lights inside the room weren't lights that you would normally see inside a room. It was a huge fluorescent light that you would see inside an office to offer lighting over once's desk area. The light happened to be over the tv area. There wasn't anywhere in the room to lounge, just two beds and a small desk with one chair. The bathroom was huge only because it was a closet for supplies in the past. The tub enclosed shower had mold growing in thick layers in the corners of the shower. Although the water was hot, I can imagined how much mold/spores I inhaled during my shower. To order room service, you had to call a restaurant several blocks away, and they would deliver and add it to your hotel bill. Parking costs $50 a day and you had to walk a block back to your hotel after parking your car. I give this hotel two thumbs down. I would have rather spent more money in another hotel and felt comfortable than to stay in this one again for free.

Reviews.Title: “It is decent for the money”
Reviews.Author: mom2gems
Reviews.Content: it is close timesquare and the rooms were good size and clean. the breakfast was in a very small area and limited but you get what you pay for if you need for room and proximity it is appealing. but I would care to walk to this hotel at night alone (be with some one or taxi it would be fine) a night the trash is all over the streets after a full day of street vendor selling , there is not restaurants nor are there many other people around after dark.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: AprilMiami
Reviews.Content: Excellent Place for the Price in NYC! It's not Times Square, but I do not have any complaints about this hotel. It was my first visit to NYC and heard how small and expensive everything was. The price was excellent for what you get. The room was very roomy, the bathroom bigger than most other hotel rooms. The rooms have recently been upgraded and have nice furniture, a comfortable bed, a vanity table. Very comfortable and super clean. There's a free continental breakfast which serves its purpose if you're hungry. I had requested a view of Empire State and Chrysler Building when I reserved and that was honored. There are two elevators, but only one reaches upper floors, sometimes that took a bit of waiting, not too bad. The area is far from the hustle and bustle of Times Square and it is extremely quiet at nights because the vendors are gone (a few shops remain open at night on the hotel street) and some streets nearby are somewhat isolated and I wouldn't feel comfortable strolling around, if you need go get somewhere it is better to take a cab if you don't want to use the subway, especially for women. But I was with my 18-year old daughter and boyfriend and no one ever bothered us. But I felt safe getting the subway, only 1/2 block away, that's how I got to everywhere. A couple of blocks south, however, it was full of people. The hotel concierge was extremely helpful and suggested a couple of restaurants within walking distance. A cheap and good pizza place is right next door to the hotel. Excellent Location to access any part of NYC--the hotel's best asset. It's quite a walk from Times Square, but we did it, after all it's New York. However, the Subway and buses are the way to go. The whole experience was positive and I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone. Enjoy your trip! I hope the pictures help you decide.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: razrlazr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located centrally to all of the major tourist attractions in Manhattan. When I stay in New York and I am paying for it, I book at the Broadway Plaza. (When my law firm clients pay, I stay in mid-town at the Hilton) Rooms at the Broadway Plaza are clean and quiet--unless your room faces Broadway, then you'll hear the horns, etc. As for the "seedy area" comments, this hotel is in the wholesale district where street vendors purchase their wares for sale. You will see Africans, Arabs, Koreans, all sorts of people. If you are afraid of people who look different than you, you may feel uncomfortable. It is very quiet at night because all the vendors are gone and the shops close down. Breakfast at the hotel is modest and the room small. But who cares, I feel safe there and the difference between the Broadway Plaza and the Hilton is $200--I will take that money and spend it on a show. Staff is very friendly, helpful, as others note.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel! Small but special!”
Reviews.Author: wholland3
Reviews.Content: The Broadway Plaza Hotel made our first visit to New York City a special one. Great location, friendly and helpful staff, and a very large and very clean room. Just one block from the subway, too. A busy neighborhood by day was somewhat deserted at night, but we always felt safe in the area. Terrific view of the Empire State Building, too. We've recommended this hotel to family and friends and look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for NYC”
Reviews.Author: My_name_is_Paesan
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at BPH to celebrate my wife's "10th 30th birthday". I was expecting a tiny room that was just clean enough. I was impressed with the size of our room on the 7th floor in NW the corner side of the building. We had a queen bed, small sofa, writing desk and spacious bathroom. Our 3 by 6 foot window looked into the alley way and buildings behind us but did add light. The room was well lit, nice TV and comfy bed. The shower was small, plastic and dark but we didn't spend a whole lotta time in it so who cared! I think I paid $189? It was a bit pricier than normal due to US Open Tennis finals and 5th year 9/11 rememberance events I think. The location is ideal for what we wanted to do, see some touron sights and lots of Broadway shows. The subway entrance is about 50 steps outside the hotel entrance. We walked most everywhere and took the subway everywhere else. The hotel is in the garment district so there are lots of businessmen buying and selling wholesale Chinese junk to each other during the day. They are just going about their day and are friendly and accomodating to the tourons roaming the streets. At night the place and streets are pretty quiet and buttoned up. We walked the 2.5 miles(?) home from the theatre district nightly and felt perfectly safe. The staff was nice friendly and always asking how they could help. We only hit breakfast once and it was adequate, coffee, fake juice and lots of bagels. About New York. The city is alive, vibrant and in great shape! The people are friendly overly helpful and seem to have a real sense of community after 9/11. We were there right before the 9/11 5th year anniversary remeberances and the city seems to go about it's business more so than the rest of the U.S.. New Yorkers live to live and seem to be more in touch with everyone around them whether they are natives or not. We saw NO homeless people, as a matter of fact I am approached by more panhandlers in the suburbs of central Texas in one morning commute than I was the whole 4 days I was in NYC! Great shows to see: Wicked, Color Purple, and Jersey Boys. A trip to The Rainbow Room atop 30 Rockafeller Center for a view of the city and Empire State Builidng at night are worth the $12 glass of wine.... Don't forget to go to men's restroom for the highest view of the city from any urinal!

Reviews.Title: “Leaves a lot to be desired!”
Reviews.Author: TravelWeary
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Broadway Plaza Hotel in November 2006 for a business trip. The hotel is in a marginal area of the city, which appears quite deserted and seedy in the evenings. The hotel is obviously much older, but appears to have recently been remodeled. It was very clean, but seemed a bit rundown. The continental breakfast consisted of danish, bagels, and doughnuts served in a tiny room with very few tables. The hotel has no restaurant and no bar. There are also very few upscale or even midscale restaurants in close vicinity. This is definitely NOT a place that I would choose to stay again, even for the low price. With the Broadway Plaza, you get what you pay for...

Reviews.Title: “Strictly a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiePeach
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights. There were more problems than benefits. Benefits: Excellent nice staff. Very helpful. Decent location, though at night there is not much open around the hotel, and as a single woman, I wasn't thrilled to be walking around there by myself. Inexpensive. The rooms are attractive. Room service is from a local restaurant ... it was very very good. Problems: I was near an office and someone was smoking all day, the hall way smelled like smoke. The window seemed like it was going to fall out of the sill; I almost asked to be moved because the window wouldn't close so it was noisy, but I wasn't going to be in the room much anyway. no coffee maker. no internet service. The continental breakfast wasn't so hot. The whole place is pretty old, and since I was by myself, I found that it was kind of dark and depressing. I was very glad to leave ... If you are on a budget, this is an affordable hotel in Manhattan. But I would only stay there again if I was desparate.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and reliable”
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy, but clean and realiable. Positives: 1. room and bathroom were very large. 2. room/bathroom were very, very clean. 3.great view of Empire State Building. 4. Very quiet!! 5.Complimentary continental breakfast was plentiful and fresh. 6. Shower water was piping hot and pressure was strong. 7.24/hr. coffee/tea in breakfast room. 8. Staff was friendly and accomodating. 9.They are happy to store your bags after you check out. Negatives: 1.Rooms were just a bit in need of sprucing up. 2.Breakfast room is tiny, just 4 tables, so most people had to haul food back to the room. 3.immediate environs just a bit seedy, but fine a couple of blocks over. 4.no lobby to speak of, just reception desk. 5. We were there last week, one of the peak travel periods, so it was grossly overpriced. Staff told me it's half of that in low season. Would definitely go back in low season, as it would be an excellent value then.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jsyd
Reviews.Content: My Mum and I stayed at the Broadway Plaza hotel for 5 nights in September. This was not our first trip to the city but it was one of the more enjoyable hotel experiences we have had. The only reason that we ended up there was that the majority of available rooms in other hotels for that time were either hugely expensive or only had 1 bed. After reading a number of differing reviews I made the choice of this hotel and I am very pleased that we did. To address other reviews, yes it is very quiet at night around the hotel and looks a little scary, but we had no problems at all and felt very safe walking around there. At all times when we passed through the front door of the hotel there was a door man who was very friendly and more than happy to offer helpful advice when we had a question. The location was fantastic, we walked up town to Times Square and beyond and also down to Greenwich Village and China Town and found it to be a very easy and enjoyable walk. There was a subway station nearby with very frequent services that took us anywhere else we wanted to go. The room was very large had 2 double beds and a large bathroom with a bathtub which was very nice after a long day of walking. And the view was amazing, the empire state building felt so close from our window that you could almost touch it! I'm sure not every room has a view like that so ask when you check in. So the airconditoning is a little bit noisey, we were one one of the higher floors so opened the window. The breakfast was a nice touch, we chose to take our breakfast back to the room and ate it enjoying the view, there was no need to sit in the small room with a lot of people walking around you. And having tea and coffee available at all times was really good as well. The thing I liked best about the hotel was how small it was, the staff were very friendly and some of the most helpful I have experienced for a long while. We lost our money in the vending machine and thought that we wouldn't get it back, no problem, just told the person at the front desk and he promptly refunded the money and gave me directions to the nearest convenience store. For those people that are interested in spending their money on designer beds and fancy toiletries, then this might not be the hotel for you, but if you have other things to spend your money on and just want a classic hotel with breakfast and friendly staff then this is probably a good choice. When I come back to New York I'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: kiwi_girl2
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and tidy and had a great view of the empire state building and staff were very friendly. Breakfast was convenient but consisted of pastries and muffins so was not what I was used to (would've been nice if there was cereal and toast). Price was very affordable compared to all the other hotels in the city (only $169 a night). Great location - real close to the subway but was in a pretty dodgy part of the city though. Otherwise it was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “First Time in New York, Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: emy197
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in New York and we were a little skeptical on this hotel. We read the reviews on Trip Advisor before we booked but decided to stay. The location was scary at first, but people are actually nice. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful and the room was great. This hotel is located near the Subway so we took the Subway everywhere. Definitly by a subway pass if you plan on staying for more than a few days, it was worth it. The hotel is located in the Flat Iron district. It is not far from the Empire State Building, but you will have to ride the Subway to get anywhere else that you want to go. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone coming to New York for a few days, it was great experience for a first time visit. We will stay here again. I have also attached a pic of our room, hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: Moonstomper
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and courteous. The location was great. Room was clean, large and comfortable (a mini bar wouldn't go amiss). Good value for money overall. The only bad thing was the token breakfast. It was only 'served' between 7 and 9am. When I did make it down in time it was just a coffee room with a few small tables (all occupied). There was a selection of donuts/bagels/pastries on the side which looked OK. I tried to pour a coffee which was weak and tasteless and in the end went to a cafe down the road on 5th avenue. I'd say getting breakfast in a cafe was part of the New York experience anyway! I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad, and the ugly...”
Reviews.Author: dezzjeter
Reviews.Content: So here's the story. The good: The Broadway Plaza has great rooms. They're clean, they're comfy, and if you're not a princess you'll be just fine. Think Holiday Inn pre-makeover. Nothing super special, but just fine. The place is small but there's nothing about the rooms to make you cringe. Certainly a better deal than Pennsylvania Hotel where my bathroom looked like something out of a horror film. The workers are generally friendly but there is some slight snappiness at the front desk when they're busy. The bad: The lobby is tiny. Not a big deal, unless you're checking in at the same time as other guests. The elevator can take forever sometimes, since there is only 1 that guests can use. The 'free breakfast' room is pretty overrated. It's more like a lounge in the back of a bank where employees drink a cheap, bad coffee mid-morning and toast bread in a toaster that grandma should have thrown out 5 years ago. The ugly: New York is not a pretty city. You will generally feel unsafe anywhere in the city, especially if you're not used to it. That said, this neighborhood is not touristy whatsoever and if you're not a New Yorker than you're going to feel out of place and possibly weary of your surroundings the first day or two. Do NOT go upstairs at the pizza place next door. There were no seats and we ventured up there only to find drug deals going down all around us. Keep in mind this is New York and it happens anyway - just maybe not as noticeably in other places. If you're going out at night, have the desk guy flag you a car. If you walk straight into the car then there are no issues. If you're in a group, not a huge deal. Nice and affordable hotels are hard to find in NYC and this one isn't horrible, but if you're a first timer and you're not "street savvy" do yourself a favor and spend a couple of extra bucks closer to Times Square where the lights are always bright and nothing lurks in the shadows. Also, note that Expedia overrated this hotel. It is not by any means more than 3 stars. Not at all.

Reviews.Title: “Right Location, Right Price”
Reviews.Author: saktunes
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel in Midtown at a good price for two adults, one teen, and one child. This hotel filled the bill. We stayed four nights in June 2006. It is one block from a subway station and is within walking distance of the Flatiron Building, the Empire State Building, Times Square, etc. We took the train to NYC and were able to walk the five or six blocks from Penn Station to this hotel. Being on Broadway, the walk north and south can be quite interesting. The area is a little bit scary at night, no so much because of unsavory characters, but because the streets are very dark. The room had two queen beds and was a nice size. The bathroom was small, but clean. There were plenty of towels and bed linens for all of us. The staff was neither friendly nor nasty, just functional. Skip the breakfast. It is not worth climbing the stairs or taking the elevator. Go to Starbucks up the street for your coffee and croissant. For just my wife and me, we would choose a hotel that is a little more upscale and romatic. However, with the children, this hotel was just about right.

Reviews.Title: “Great view - good value”
Reviews.Author: BirdieDenmark
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel i july 2005 for 3 nigths with my husbond. We got a room on the 4 th floor with a great view of the Empire State Building. It's in walking distance of most of the attractions. The breakfast is allright, and the staff is very helpfull. The only negative thing is that the surrounding streets seems a bit unfriendly. However, we did not have any problems. The value is good, considering N.Y. prices.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit not as good”
Reviews.Author: designermedusa
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at The Broadway Plaza hotel, and I have to say I was disappointed this time. The good parts were both double beds were comfortable, the staff was friendly as always and the downtown location is convenient if you love downtown. The bad parts were the air conditioner had to be turned off after five minutes because of a very loud noise, the bathtub had standing water during each shower because it was draining very slowly and the elevator was very slow. If you are staying above the 7th floor there is only one elevator, and it is very slow. The worst part was I went to get an extra pillow from the shelf, and there was what looked like ceiling tile on the pillow. I looked up and saw the ceiling looked to be chewed or scratched through. A piece of carboard had been taped up, but you could still see the hole in the ceiling. We saw no rodent, but it appears they have a problem. Eventhough the building is old like most NYC hotels, they should still be able to control a rodent problem. Even with all these problems we still mostly enjoyed our stay, but were disappointed by the problems with the room. I'd consider staying at the hotel again, but only if I couldn't find anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Great price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: No bugs or animals loved the room lots of space worth the stay

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Gary-and-Viv
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, clean and tidy hotel/room. 24hr tea and coffee a great idea, (buy some mugs if you don't like polystyrene cups). Breakfast of donuts or toasted Bagels and cream cheese/jam, unusual to us Brits but tasty for a week. Overall a great place to stay and central to most attractions. If you read previous poor reviews note the following:- 1) People are outside with black plastic bin liners because they have bought their 'minimum of 10 items or more' from the wholesale shops lining the street and thats how they are packaged. They do not try to sell to you and it means there is people about all the tme and so its as safe as any where else, (and I am a worrier). It does look ominous when you first get there but its no problem. 2) The toilet did block but thats because of the design, not the plumbing, so just be carefull. 3) The lift, its called waitng for it, have patience it works fine. 4) The bed was very comfortable. Compared to Hotels in this country it was very good and we would definiteley stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Garbage Dump”
Reviews.Author: ryanrxb
Reviews.Content: My first time to the US and I absolutely loved NY. I will come back to this city but there is no way I will ever stay in this hotel again. The neighbourhood was not the best and the hotel was made to look very scruffy by all the garbage bag people outside. My girlfriend was actually scared to walk around the area just outside the hotel. The morning breakfast consisted of a few plates of dry cup cakes and cream cakes. I never ate in the hotel after the first day. I also got ripped off by vending machines that did not work properly. The room was scruffy, the carpet was ancient and the bathroom (quite clean) was very dated. The bed was a disaster and I had a bad time sleeping during my stay. On the first night I thought I could hear rats/mice scratching on the walls! Total rip off for the money I spent, i know i could have had much better for my money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tigga23
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel late the night before St Patrick's Day, initially to stay for one night only. Staff were excellent, very accomodating when I requested extending my stay. Great hotel for, great price. Room was massive and very clean. Location is excellent. Would definitely stay at the Broadway Plaza next time I'm in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Broadway Plaza Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nora1999
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to NYC, and I've always been told you can't get a decent hotel room in this town under $200/night. Naturally I was a bit suspicious when the rate for the Broadway Plaza Hotel was quoted at $119/night on Travelocity, but the reviews were, for the most part, pretty good and the location seemed acceptable, so I decided to give it a shot. Man, was I glad I did! I love this hotel! The staff is so friendly and helpful, the room was HUGE, and the continental breakfast and 24 hour coffee was great! True, some have griped about the neighborhood a bit and it's true that the hotel is located in the northern part of the Garment district, but I absolutely loved this colorful area of town. The neighborhood has a very genuine feel to it - this IS NYC, not some phony tourist creation!!! The area clears out at night after the shops close, and it's very tranquil and peaceful then. In no way did I ever feel even slightly unsafe. Also, Times Square and the Flatiron building are just a short walk away, and there's a subway station right at 28th Street which is so convenient! This place rocks and I plan to stay here again on my next NYC adventure! Highest recommendation!!!

Reviews.Title: “just the job for a couple of nights”
Reviews.Author: TravellingIsGood
Reviews.Content: i needed an overnight hotel stop in between moving apartments in NY - booked this via Orbitz as it was, well cheap. $98 for the night plus it said it offered room service. I arrived to be told the hotel was overbooked but they had found me a room - it was a very large room with 2 double beds and a simply enormous bathroom by any NY standards so I suspect if I'd got a $98 room things may have been different. For me the best thing about the room was it was SO quiet outside, literally the odd car going past but no beeping horns or other NY noises. "Room service" turns out to be a restaurant next door the hotel has hooked up with which during my stay was closed for renovations but I did get other menus brought to my room plus when the food arrived the security man called me first to let me know etc, I thought that was good. If I was staying in NY for more than 3 nights I'd probably pick another location but if you happen to just need a place to crash then I recommend this hotel. PS other reviewers have criticised the neighborhood - yes there are a few geezers hanging around trying to sell you sunglasses or whatever but 1. they go home when the shops shut 2. as a single woman from the UK living in NY I can tell you this is NOT a threatening neighborhood; you just need to look like you know where you are going so they don't mark you as a muppet 3. there are far far worse areas of Manhattan. Try Port Authority if you want dodgy geezers.

Reviews.Title: “A great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had booked the hotel over the internet and was a bit wary from some of the mixed reviews on this site. I had nothing to fear. Upon arrival we were offered a room with a view looking out at the Empire State. The room was spacious for the 2 of us and the bathroom was certainly larger than the Howard johnson I stayed at last year. The room was clean and the service was friendly and efficient. The neighbourhood is not the greatest in New York. There were certainly crowds of young men selling furs, watches and sportswear from black bags in the street outside during the day but we didn't encounter any problems apart from very busy sidewalks. The area had cleared when we walked back to the hotel at night and we certainly did not feel threatened despite a couple of late night walks back. We were never approached by anyone. I've had scarier journeys home in many a city in the UK. The subway is close by and the hotel is in easy walking distance to the Flatiron and Midtown areas.

Reviews.Title: “Hell on Broadway!”
Reviews.Author: sricha
Reviews.Content: This hotel is terrible. It is a trap - it appears like a less expensive option when staying in Manhattan - but trust me usually in manhattan you pay $300 a night and stay in what should be a $150 a night hotel - here you pay $150 a stay in what should be a $40 a night hotel. 1.) There is an awful smell permeating the entire hotel that can only be described as somewhere between rotting food and cheap cleaning agent. I can't overemphasize how a bad smell can ruin an entire stay. 2.) The Elevators don't work. As mentioned prevously the 7th floor (where the vending machines were) was essentially unreachable by elevator - unless you have a crowbar to break down the elevator door. By the way the staircase smells disgusting - I found this out when I was trapped on the 7th floor. 3.) The neighborhood is VERY scary. I am a fairly seasoned traveller and even I was scared (not to mention my wife who was very fearful stepping out the hotel door). I am postive there were drugs being sold outside the hotel doors and purse snatchers on the prowl. Ask any cabbie and they will tell you this is NOT a tourist area. While the website points out how close the hotel is to major attracttions - you have to run a gauntlet of aggressive peddlers to get to them. 4.) While the bathroom was recently rennovated - the shower pressure was terrible - I would have been better off splashing myself in the sink. It wasn't all bad 1.) Doorman was really good. This area is tough to get cabs and he does a great job - he should go work for a better hotel. 2.) Wireless internet worked great. STAY AWAY DON'T FALL FOR THE TRAP

Reviews.Title: “We loved the "gritty" area - Very safe.”
Reviews.Author: Yippeeyiyo
Reviews.Content: Having flown 22 hrs to arrive in NYC for our first visit, we were greeted by a wonderful Doorman, "Richard" and front desk staff in the evening. If you need anything done or any info. Richard is the man to ask! In fact all the staff were pleasant here. Stayed for 7 glorious nights. Having read other reviews about the "grittiness" of the area, we welcomed it as part of a true NYC experience, as opposed to staying in a touristy area. Bustling during the day, however surprisingly quiet at night. Never a feeling of being unsafe at all. Our room on the 6th floor (606) looked straight at Empire State Building. Large Superior Room (2 beds), small dining table, desk, loads of cupboard and hanging space, large bathroom & heated. Very clean, plenty of towels available. Room had a personal safe also...added bonus. Excellent access to Subways, eateries, taxis, bars & clubs and many many NYC attractions. We thought it was the perfect place to stay & would definitely stay again. The only negative we found, was the house-keeping staff tended to be a little noisy in the mornings. A little bit of door banging going on and chatting in the hallways amongst themselves, became annoying when trying to have a sleep-in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Blueysmrs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. We were travelling with our two kids as well as another couple. Both rooms were on the 4th floor - 403 for the couple faced the street and was roomy but had street noise at night. 408 was at the back and very quiet. Huge room although tiny shower. Rooms were very clean. Breakfast consisted of pastries, bagels, tea, coffee, juice (toaster available as is butter and jam). Always seemed to be plenty available. Staff were extremely helpful with all our questions etc. When we arrived at the hotel (7.30pm) we were a bit unsure of what it would be like because the neighbourhood didn't look so good but it was excellent and the neighbourhood was fine. Hotel was handy to tourist sights and the on/off bus so suited us just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: fekq
Reviews.Content: After reading nearly all the hotel reviews for NY on TripAdvisor, I went for this one, as it was reasonably priced for a largish room. Went with my mother, for our first-time trip to NY and was very pleased with the hotel. We had one of the superior rooms (as I didn't want us to be falling over each other) and had clean room with two double beds, freshly decorated, good size bathroom with plenty of towels, great view of ESB and plenty of space. Staff were very pleasant and helpful, the traffic noise (on the 9th floor) much quieter than I expected, and the breakfast of unlimited bagels, cakes and muffins fatal for the waistline! Liked the 24hr tea and coffee available in the breakfast room (so didn't miss not having a kettle in room). Easy to get around from, plenty of cabs on 6th and 5th ave. Broadway by the hotel is rather dark and quiet late on, which unnerved my mum a bit - would recommend you walk up/down 5th ave, then turn down 27th st to the hotel, rather than walking down the latter part of Broadway. In the day time we had no hassle (no hassle at night either - in fact it was too quiet!) I'd definitely recommend this to someone who wants a decent, but not fancy schmancy hotel at a sensible price.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel... Bad billing policies. Abusive management.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Untill recently I had always had nothing but good expieriences with this hotel. I made my reservation mid october. When I arrived to check in the rate that I had been quoted had changed. Though it may have been a fair rate it for that time of year. It was in fact different than what I was quoted. When I pointed it out they gladly agreed that the orignial quoted rate would stand. They were having some work done on thier elevators that weekend thus there was some minor inconvienience due to noise and availability. Also the cleaning staff never actually cleaned my room. None of this affected my Opinion of the hotel. I had always stayed there when visiting new york and figured some growing pains are part of any enterprise. When I went to check out I found that they had not changed the rate. it was signifigantly higher than what I had been originally quoted and agreed upon. They told me I must have misunderstood. Since a misunderstanding was possible I offered to split the difference with them. They stood by thier increased rate. then I found out that they had actually changed all the room rates the day I had checked in, to lower than the comprimise I was offering. They did not give in. They outright denied my complaints about noise and the cleaning staff and stood fast on thier rate. I told them they left me no other options but to file a grievence with my credit card company and the management got mad and abusive. I left. I have filed my greivance and in addition I plan to file reviews about my expierience as is my right. It doesn't matter how helpfull the staff is if managment is unruly and unyeilding. Regardless of how rightous they felt about thier rate. I was not satisfied and they ignored my complaints. As it stands I will never stay there again and can't recomend the expierience to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: lizflint
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on October 28 for one night in a junior suite, which had a two queen beds, a living room area, and a large bathroom. It was a very nice and quiet room. We were on the second floor, but really didn't experience too much noise. The staff was very helpful in hailing a cab for us and recommending a good place to eat breakfast. The subway was close and on a line that accesses Times Square and Central Park. Yes, there are cheap shops around, but who cares? That's part of New York. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we spent 5day's at the hotel and staff could not be nicer from edward the doorman and his team to cleaning team and the front desk team all were very helpfull! the hotel is what you make of it despite what other people say there are pub's in the area all you have to do is ask or look!!we found an irish bar on 31st called o'rielly's find it the food in the attatched restaraunt was superb, nice bar to relax in and chill staff all very nice ,we stayed on the 9th floor good view's of empire state building,also subway 1 min away, all attractions minutes away by subway. overall i would stay in the hotel if i was going to new york again and would recomend in to anyone .

Reviews.Title: “Not what you think-Broadway Plaza”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We book the hotel based on the picture and the way it look which is very deceiving. If you don't look closly you will miss the hotel entrance among all the gate on the store fronts. The lobby is the size of my very small apartment dinning room. The rooms were clean and a good size but you couldn't look at your self in the mirror of the bathroom and have the door open. The breakfest they talk about is bad coffee and old donuts. The breakfast/coffee room is on the 4th floor and smaller than our hotel room. The staff was friendly but the man who was the door man our first day was then the front desk person the next night. There were no bars or resturant in the area and at night the street were very dark and abandon.

Reviews.Title: “central, comfortable, good value”
Reviews.Author: KC-belfast
Reviews.Content: we picked this hotel after reading some of the reviews and for the money it was one of the more central and higher recommended places to go. I was not disappointed The room was a good size, clean, comfortable and everything worked. All you really need when you are just sleeping there after spending your day on your feet seeing the sights. Maybe if you were on a romantic weekend break you could go a bit more upmarket and go to one of the bigger hotels with views over central park or nearer time square. The hotel is a bit off the tourist centre but this means it is quiet at nightime when you are trying to get to sleep, though you are only 2 stops on the subway from times square and 15mins walk to the empire state or macys. During the day the shops around sell cheap watches and t-shirts, but it didn't feel any worse than walking through any city. Big bonus is that the subway is one block away and is on the broadway line so you can get to most places you want to go quickly and easily. We felt quite safe using the subway and it was never crowded and intimidating like the london underground can be. If you want delis there are a few in 6th avenue a block away, plus a mcdonalds for milkshakes at 11pm if you want. There is an excellent jazz club and barbecue style restaurant on 27th and lexington 'jazz standard'. There are also good views of the empire state building from most rooms so you can check for visibility at the observation deck before you go. The breakfast was fine. bagels, doughnuts and pastries. Having tea/coffee and orange juice available all day was very good. There are vending machines as well if that isn't enough. We were happy with the hotel and it really suited our needs

Reviews.Title: “great find.”
Reviews.Author: cocapeddle
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel directly after reading many reviews on this website. I stayed here for a week and would definitely recommend it as good value for money, especially compared to some similarly priced hotels in New York. The rooms were big, clean (maid came every day with fresh towels) and the concierge were really polite and helpful. This wasn't my first time in New York so I felt perfectly safe in the area (contrary to some reviews on here) but I think if recommending to a first time visitor, I would say the area is fairly quiet at night with not much happening so you might prefer staying a bit further uptown or further down in Soho however, I don't really have a bad word to say about my experience here. Breakfast is adequate and they don't mind you taking it to your room. It's very well situated in that a brisk 20 minute walk you are in soho, 10 minute walk in the other direction you are in Times Square. Would definitely recommend a stay here (and I'm fairly fussy!)

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with our choice of hotel”
Reviews.Author: lfl
Reviews.Content: Thanks to a really good rate from Travelocity, we stayed at the Broadway Plaza for 4 nights at the end of August. We had an 8th floor room with a direct view of the Empire State Building, which is nicely lit up in the evening. The carpet was not clean our first night (needed vacuuming) but I left a note for housekeeping and it was taken care of the next morning. Other than that, the room and the bathroom were clean and spacious (much larger than another NYC hotel my husband stayed in earlier this year) and the A/C on low kept the room comfortable. It must have also drowned out any city noises because we slept very well all 4 nights. The staff was friendly all 4 days. The continental breakfast is limited, but you can at least get a bagel (or a pastry), juice and coffee each morning. If the breakfast area is too crowded, just take the food to your room. The hotel is very convenient to a subway station (go out the door and turn left; walk just over 1 block). Between the hotel and the subway station there are "wholesale" stores selling clothes, perfume and electronics. In addition, at certain times of day, there are lots of sidewalk vendors, so walking through with luggage can be a challenge, but it never seemed dangerous, just crowded. We were very pleased with our choice. A similarly sized room in a nicer area of NYC would easily cost more than twice what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “It has many shortcomings”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean. Other than that, I cannot say why we would want to stay there again. The room was very noisy due to the fact that all night long trucks moved freight in and out of the many counterfeit merchandise businesses that surround the hotel, and the roomâ€™s windows are not sound proof. The room was very hot and we could not turn on the air conditioning because it was very old and even noisier. Although the hotel advertised that we would get either a king size bed or two queens, we did not get either. We were given a room with one queen size bed. We had chosen this hotel over others because we have a baby and we needed the space, but they told me that they did not see this request in their reservations system and blamed travel agency. They stated that they were full to capacity and they could not offer us a different room. This was Friday night in New York City, and it would have been very difficult for us to find another room in another hotel. Therefore, we had to stay as a consequence. If you want a cheap hotel, are not planing on staying in it for too much time, don't mind not sleeping well and are not traveling with children, this might be a good choice. For us, it is not now nor will it ever be an alternative in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Broadway Plaza and found it to be a well kept, clean hotel with LARGE rooms. The staff was very nice and always willing to help. The suite we stayed in had two queen size beds and a sitting area with a fold out couch. The bathroom was HUGE. We could see the Empire State Building out our window. Admittedly, this hotel has no street appeal. It is just a doorway with an awning over it flanked by a wig shop and clothing store. The immediate neighborhood is one of import/export stores selling clothes, perfume, shoes etc. A 'real" New York neighborhood which might put off the first time visitor but it was safe and we never found a reason for concern. At night the stores all shut down making it one of the quietest we have ever stayed in when visiting Manhatten. Within a block or two are numerous nice restaurants. The subway is one block away. We would stay here again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just back from my second stay at the Broadway Plaza, and it more the matched the standards of my last stay. This time I got a room on the 11th floor, which gave me a brilliant view of the Empire State Building and the beautiful Chrysler Building as well. The room was a nice size, clean, serviced every day. The breakfast is well worth getting, although I'd use the tray provided in your room and take it back there rather then eat in the very small dining area. The staff were once again extremely helpful and plesant, many of them I recognised from last year. The location is pretty much all I could have wished for, Macys, Times Square, Empire State Building, Chrysler Building and Grand Central Station are all within easy walking distance, Battery Park and the financial district is only a short bus ride from the corner outside the hotel, and there are plenty of places to eat close by. The area outside is very busy during the day and has many street traders, but I was never bothered by anyone, as a female travelling on her own I never felt anything but completely safe during my time in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Mymsie
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in this hotel for 10 days from August 4th-14th.2005 We needed an hotel with a room which was large enough to accomodate five adults, and that's exactly what we got, a very large room on a lower floor with two Queen Beds and a lounge area with sofa sleeper. Room was serviced each day, and was large & comfortable. Coffee, juice & pastries available each morning included in the tariff, and the doormen were most knowledgeable & helpful. I think I may have been overcharged for one extra person but have not checked that fully. Room, although overlooking the street, was quiet, and had a small fridge, certainly one of the largest hotel rooms I have stayed in. Area was very busy, and although cleaned up each night by the city cleaners, the number of businesses in the area create for a lot of litter and crowding which I am sad to say detracts from the hotel, the city should do more to keep the area clean.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the rodents in rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Checked in and was very pleased with the size of the room (large by NYC standards). But on my final night, a rodent (not sure if it was a mouse or rat) ran across my room floor and under the couch. When I called down, the maintenance man wasn't overly surprised. One of his jobs, he tells me, is to inspect and fill in holes from the rodents. I did get to change rooms, but there was no attempt to compensate for this incident. Wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: duniel
Reviews.Content: The Broadway Plaza Hotel is really above average. The rooms (esp. bathrooms) are very spacious, very clean, and the staff is helpful and polite. The lobby and the breakfast room are small, yes but hey... who cares. We took the food and the coffee to our room and had our breakfast there :) OK, there were a lot of street sellers around the hotel location, but the atmosphere is really far from threatening. Within ten minutes you are at Macys and the Empire State Building. A Metro Station is a minute away, so you can reach almost every location within minutes... I highly recommend this hotel!!! It was a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Broadway Plaza EXCELLENT!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time seaching hotels on the web for NYC and finally settled on the Broadway Plaza, thanks in large part to reviews on this website. We were not disappointed. The location could not have been better, just a few blocks walk to everything. When we arrived on a Sat. the area outside the hotel was the most off-putting part of the stay, very crowded street in front of a very small entrance with lots of bootlegged DVDs on display. But we prompty forgot all that on seeing the room. It was very clean with a large bathroom and a wonderful view of the Empire State Building (8th floor). The staff were very friendly and quite helpful, as was all of New York. I definately will return to NYC and would stay again at the Broadway Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend Broadway Plaza Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ldnurse
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the basis of previous reviews by Trip Advisor members, and they were right on! My friend and I stayed here Aug. 8-11 and were not disappointed! The first impression was a bit unsettling, seeing all the sidewalk vendors right outside the hotel entrance, but they are all over New York, and never bothered us. The staff was always polite, and very helpful. The entire place was very clean, even the stairwells! The room was quite spacious, and had a comfortable bed with plenty of pillows. It was tastefully decorated and appeared to have a new tub, sink and toilet. Again, everything was spotless! It was great to have a hair dryer, and all the little bottles of lotions and shampoos, as I forgot mine! They offered a continental breakfast with pastries that were unlike any I've EVER had at a hotel! The fresh rolls were HUGE, and easily could have fed two people! Unlike the other reviews that complained of the long wait and the crowded room, we never had to stand in line, and there was plenty for everyone! It was a real treat and saved us from having to spend time looking for a restaurant, as we were on the go from early morning until late evening. The only negative was that our TV didn't seem to work very well, but we never said anything about it, and we were actually too tired to watch it anyway. We asked for washcloths one night, when we noticed they hadn't been replenished, and they were brought up within minutes! It was also the most QUIET hotel I've ever stayed at! I'm a light sleeper and only one time did I hear anything at all. I know they had many guests, but I felt like we had the place to ourselves! It was most convenient to the subway, which was one block away, and only a few blocks to the Empire State Building. It was about a half hour walk to the theatre district, so it is a little out of the way, but for the great price, which I booked through cheaptickets, and the wonderful room and staff, it was worth the walk! I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Large Rooms and Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: MikeyBBQ
Reviews.Content: True this isnt the greatest neighborhood and the lobby and entrance way are ultra small - but the rooms are huge according to NYC standards! I found my room clean, spacious, well air conditioned and with a full length bathtub! The nieghborhood is a bit dicey but Starbucks and chic shops are just a few blocks away. The staff were friendly and accommodated my request for an early check-in (for just $20 extra). High speed internet access is available for a modest fee and 800 calls are free. I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week, we had booked two rooms together, paid extra for one room with three separate beds. Rooms were several floors apart, had to wait 24hours before being moved together. but the 3 bed room -only got a room with two double beds.... When we complained we were told that they didn't have rooms with 3 beds... We were given a fold away bed, but there wasn't any foot space between beds and wall then. Had to climb over beds to get to bathroom. Tried it for one night, but so uncomfortable we gave up, Brother and sister teens had to share a double bed. Imagine my suprise when I read on here that some one had two double beds AND a sofa bed!! We requested an extra pillow for my 63 yr old mum several times, and were told it would be brought up, it didn't arrive all week. The cleaners repeatedly ignored the "do not disturb" sign and woke my mum up several times when she was unwell. We also had one of the kids new mp3 players mysteriosly dissapear from the room without trace, while we were at breakfast. Other than that, hotel was clean, facilities good, desk staff helpful and an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, truly wonderful”
Reviews.Author: mikey_westmids
Reviews.Content: Don't believe everything you read ! Thats my advice. We spent hours looking for hotels in New York and then reading the reviews on this website, finally we decided on the Broadway. For its price it is probably the best decision we ever made. We took into account the reviews on here and booked via the internet. SUGGESTION - If you can, request the 13th Floor......you have the whole floor to yourself as its just one room (helps with the lift queues anyway) and the room is gigantic, with a bigger than kingsize bed. I am 6ft 5 and i felt lost in it ! The most important factor of this room was the unbelievable view of the Empire State! (You can even see your hotel room from the top of the Empire State too!! Sad i know) Yes there were a lot of street sellers and people around the hotel location, but the atmosphere is FAR from threatening. 10 minutes walk will see you in the centre of time square.......for the price of the hotel, thats a pretty damn good location. If i were to return to New York, I would have no hesitation whatsoever of booking in at the Broadway Plaza. Its not just 5 out of 5, its 10 out of 10 for me. Whatever you decide, have a safe journey :o)

Reviews.Title: “No interest in garment district or Hair emporium”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Located next to the Hair emporium (they sell 100% real hair or 100% synthetic hair NO BLENDS!!) in the very unfashionable garment district, the Broadway Plaza is only for the budget minded. The downsides: All street vendors in all of New York must meet outside this hotel both before and after work and thatâ€™s not a good thing. The hotel rooms are clean but a bit dingy. The drop ceilings and florescent lighting make the hotel experience feel more like a night at the office instead of a night a hotelâ€”complete with lumpy bed. Guest will feel safe knowing there are lots of sprinklers in some roomsâ€”mine had 5. Elevators apparently must run on the top and bottom of the hour as there was always a wait to get one. The upsides: The hotel is cheap, located close to other areas you might want to visit, and some rooms had great views of the Empire State building â€“ I wanted to jump out of it instead of return to my hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Adequate”
Reviews.Author: rlbintegrity
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the Broadway Plaza. We arrived a day early, and while the hotel had rooms available, they wanted to charge $55 above the rate we had confirmed - so, we spent one night at the Edison (who accomodated us at the last minute) and two nights at the Broadway Plaza. The front desk was businesslike, and neither added or subtracted anything from our stay. The concierge Richard is very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. Long waits for elevators is routine. Breakfast was nothing remarkable. Broadway Pizza next door serves a very nice breakfast for under $3.00. Subway is convienient. We did not like the neighborhood at all. Loud, vulgar, sweaty people crowd the sidewalks. It's not that we felt unsafe, it was just unpleasant. Plus, this hotel is not close to much of anything. But, that's why the price is so reasonable. Overall, we liked the Edison better.

Reviews.Title: “In the Middle of Garment District”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I were very satisfied with the service and the room. We arrived early, but that was just fine because we left our luggage with the Hotel Receptionist and went shopping right outside the hotel. By the time we walked 1 block, we purchased cologne, purses, walking suits and a leather wallet. We were even satisfied with the food off the street cart (chicken and gyro on pita bread). It was great that the hotel managed to keep an upscale look among all of the action right outside of its doors. Keep up the great service Broadway Plaza. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, large rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Broadway Plaza on business in April, usually I stay midtown but I wanted to stay closer to meeting location near battery park. For the price, you cannot beat this hotel. I've stayed in $300 rooms in NYC that aren't even close to the size and view that this hotel offers. I stayed on the top floor, awesome view of the Empire State Building. Location is just okay, but obviously that is why it is cheaper than midtown. Macy's is seven blocks north, Union Square is 10 blocks south, subway very close to hotel. Had a few minor issues with the high speed internet, but other than that, I have only positive impressions and will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Manhattan lodging”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you plan on spending more time seeing the city than hanging out in your hotel, this is definitely a great place to stay. Very reasonable priced with really large rooms, especially for NYC. A relatively small hotel on 27th and Broadway, which many reviewers refer to as a shady area. It's not bad at all, I stayed there during Spring Break with 3 other college girls from California. If we can handle it, anyone can. The concierge, Richard is the really friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, tidy, and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For the price, I felt this was a great deal. I got a clean, comfortable room in NY without spending what it cost me to fly there from CA. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room, view and value.”
Reviews.Author: CDB199
Reviews.Content: I too booked a 6 night stay based on the reviews of the Broadway Plaza here on tripadvisor and was not left disappointed with the result. If your looking for a reasonably priced hotel that is both clean and excellently located....i cant see how you can go wrong here! The hotel is 2 blocks from the Empire State....very close to Madison Square Gardens and only 10 mins walk to Time Square. (also v.close to a subway station!) Our room was fresh, with a great view....reasonably quiet, large, serviced by maids daily and all in all top value for money. For my first trip to New York....i dont think i could have got a better deal. If it wasnt for the slowness of the list and the fact that i have been to some more impressive 5 star hotels in my time..........Broadway would probably have gained 5/5.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Mostly Okay, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Carol119
Reviews.Content: We had a three night stay and found most of the reviews to be on target (Thank you TripAdvisor). We liked the location and convenience to the subway. We left a play in Times Square, it was pouring rain and we were steps to the subway back and steps to the hotel, barely getting wet. Our room was fairly large but had one tiny window with no view. The layout made no sense. The door opened right onto the bed, and at the foot of the bed was the dresser which was so close you couldn't roll a suitcase by it so we moved it during our stay. The bathroom was also large but the toilet, sink and shower were all bunched on one wall, with a small shower. We considered moving the dresser into the bathroom. But we were comfortable while we were there. The real plus is the staff! Others have noted Richard, the consierge, but we also had great experiences with desk clerks and housekeeping. We went to the breakfast room the first day, but with so many wonderful places to eat in NYC, it was not worth returning. Overall, we got a 'special' rate so the value was very good for New York. PS we really liked the neighborhood during the day, but there wasn't much around there in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Neighborhood Definitely Sketchy!”
Reviews.Author: joeyp
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 7 day stay in NYC - April 10-16, 2005 with my mother and 10 year old daughter. We were pleased with the actual hotel however you must know that the neighborhood is definitely sketchy! We were approached every 10 feet to buy counterfeit purses from some shady characters. On Saturday and Sunday it was so crowded walking on the street I had to hold my 10 year old very close. She was a little scared and didn't like the environment. The hotel itself was clean and the rooms were big. The continental breakfast was very convenient however I would recommend going on the early side because the breakfast room is VERY small and it gets very crowded around 8:45 am - 9:00 am. The subway is close and very convenient. I would stay there again ONLY because of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: FF
Reviews.Content: Just back from a three night stay in NYC. I chose this hotel based on previous reviews, and I didn't regret it. My room was huge (and not just by NY standards!) and although it had no view (in fact the window was very small and gave on a backyard), it was very pleasant, also the bathroom was huge and clean. The continental breakfast (a rare thing in NYC apparently) was OK, although - as indicated by previous reviewers, if you show up after 8 you will want to take your food to your room, as the breakfast lounge is very small. All in all, excellent value for money (particularly if you manage to get a good rate -- I paid $149 plus tax per night through the hotel website, and as hotel rates go in NYC, it was a bargain!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: TheRealEngineer
Reviews.Content: We (Family of 2 Adults and a 10 year old child) booked for 9 days at The Broadway Plaza after reading the reviews on this web-site. What we wanted was a hotel that offered value for money as well as being on Manhattan itself. We also needed a smoking room and wanted a private bathroom.
